title: Morton's Neuroma Treatment
content: Morton's neuroma is a painful condition affecting the interdigital nerve, typically between the third and fourth metatarsals. Conservative management includes footwear modifications with wider toe box, metatarsal pads, and activity modification. Corticosteroid injections provide temporary relief. For persistent symptoms, surgical neurectomy or neurolysis may be considered, with approximately 80% of patients reporting good to excellent outcomes.
